org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.util.date
Class ChronoDate

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.util.date.ChronoDate
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultChronoDate, FastChronoDate
public abstract class ChronoDate
extends java.lang.Object

A specialized date class for use with the Chronoscope framework.

Author:
chad takahashi

add

public abstract void add(TimeUnit timeUnit,
                         int numUnits)
Adds the specified number of time units to this date. Implementations of this method are expected to handle "rollover" scenarios, where adding numUnits to this date would cause the next largest time unit to increment.

copy

public ChronoDate copy()
Returns a copy of this date.

Parameters:

set

public abstract DateFieldSetter set()
Sets the constituent components of this date via method chaining. For example, to set the date to 'January 19th, 1956': 
 myDate.set().year(1956).month(0).day(19).done();
Don't forget to call DateFieldSetter.done()! Otherwise the date modifications will not take effect.

set

public abstract void set(TimeUnit dateField,
                         int value)
Sets the specified date field to the specified value.

NOTE: If you need to set more than 1 date field, use set() instead. This method defers date field validation until the DateFieldSetter.done() method is called.

setTime

public abstract void setTime(double ms)
Analagous to java.util.Date.setTime().

truncate

public abstract ChronoDate truncate(TimeUnit timeUnit)
Truncates this date up to the specified time unit. For example, if myDate = '1987-Mar-12 14:30:59', then truncate(myDate, TimeUnit.MONTH) will truncate this date up to the month resulting in the date '1987-Mar-01 00:00:00'.

Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the specified timeUnit is not supported by a particular subclass.

timeZoneConverter

public static double timeZoneConverter()
If you have to consider time zone,convert the current time zone to set time zone

Returns:
Local time zone and set the time zone difference between the value
